alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 9:53PM EDT until June 11 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Bracken and Pendleton. In Southwest Ohio, Clermont. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Felicity, Butler, Neville, Chilo, Foster, Mount Auburn, Lenoxburg, Willow Grove, Kincaid Lake State Park, Bradford, Catawba and Greenwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
